publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

history.provenance: found in Qizil Miŋ-Öyduring T III MQ 17.39

seg.seg: ... for a (thou)sand years ... (of) you ... a(ll) (I) announce ... Previously, there was (no) (living be)ing n(a)med human dearer to me than (you).
No human being has [ever] before been dearer to me than you, and none will be dearer to me than you afterwards.
Hereafter, likewise there will be no one (d)earer to me than you. [My] affection for you, [my] love for you are together like breath
with life. Th(is) shall not change [all my] life long. Thus I was constantly thinking: "With the very beloved one
So dachte ich: "Mit der einen Geliebten werde ich gut [wtl. (zum) Guten] leben ein Leben lang ohne Trug [und] ohne Verstellung(?)."
Thus I thought: "With the one beloved I will live well [lit. (to the) good] all [my] life without lie [and] without pretence(?)."
I will live (for) good lifelong, without deceit, without ..."
God Karma for one knew [that] this is my thought. Thus he evoked excitation.

Gott Karman allein wusste solches mein Denken. Deshalb rief er Zwietracht hervor [oder: rief bei sich Neid hervor] [und] entriss mir das dir gehörige Herz. Er führte dich fort, trennte mich ab [und] ließ mich an allen Leiden teilhaben. Die Freude an dir nahm er mir fort.

God Karman only knew this my thinking. Therefore he evoked discord [or: evoked envy in himself] [and] wrested from me the heart belonging to you. He led you away, separated me [and] let me partake of all sufferings. The joy in you he took away from me.
He pulled out my heart which belongs to you. He led you far away and separated me [from you].
He made me take part in all sufferings and depriv(ed me) of the joy provided by you.
... my life, my spir(it), my heart day by day ...

p.note: German translation after 80: Früher war mir (kein) Mensch genanntes Wesen lieber als du, auch später ist mir keins lieber als du. [2c] Die Liebe zu dir, das Gefallen an dir ist Atem zusammen mit dem Leben. Dieses soll sich lebenslänglich nicht ändern. [2d] So dachte ich: Mit der einen Geliebten werde ich gut leben lebenslänglich ohne Trug [und] ohne Gehabe (?). [3a] Der Gott Karman allein wußte solches mein Denken. Deshalb rief er Zwietracht hervor [und] entriß mir das dir gehörige Herz. [3b] Er führte dich fort, trennte mich ab [und] ließ mich teilhaben an allen Leiden. Die Freude an dir nahm er (mir) fort.

French translation after 32: ... mille ans ... [2c] D'être vivant portant le nom d'humain, il n'en fut pas auparavant de plus cher pour moi que toi, et il n'en sera pas non plus dans l'avenir de plus cher que toi pour moi. [2d] L'affection pour toi, l'amitié pour toi constitue le souffle associé à la vie tout ensemble. Ceci ne doit pas changer la vie durant. [3a] Ainsi je ne cessais de penser: Avec une unique amante je vivrai pour le bonheur la vie durant, sans duperie ni tromperie. [3b] Le die Acte seul a su cette pensée mienne. C'est pourquoi il a suscité la querelle, il m'a arraché le cœur tien. [3c] Il t'a emmenée au loin, il m'a entraîné á part, il m'a fait prendre part à toutes les souffrances; il m'a enlevé la consolation que tu étais. [3d] ... la vie, l'esprit, le cœur miens, jour après jour ...

English translation after 26–28: ... for a thousand years however, Thou wilt tell the story (?) Thy ... I announce, [2b] Heretofore there was no human being dearer to me than thee, likewise hereafter there will be no one dearer to me than thee. [2c] Thy love! Thy affection! [My] jubilant song rises up! Along with life [itself], this should not come to an end for [my] whole life. [2d] Thus I was thinking: “I will live with one lover well [for the whole of my] life, without deceit, without ...” [3a] The Karma-god alone recognized this, my thought. Thus he provoked a quarrel; it ripped out my heart [that belonged] to thee; [3b] it led thee afar, it tore me apart, it turned me into a partaker of all sorrows; he took away the consolation [I had] in thee. [3c] ... my life, spirit, and heart day-by-day ...

307 fn. 9 corrects pikala to pik{w}ala, but the loss of the labial element of the labiovelar could be a feature of colloquial/late TB, see . The form ask(a)sk(au) could be a colloquial/late form of aksaskau and not a spelling error, cf. colloquial Engl. aks for ask. Colloquial/late noṣ śomo for nauṣ śaumo, for the change au > o see 53f.

(ya)ltse is emended by 307 fn. 8. watäṃ may also be read as wat, i.e. wa_t\•, cf. 307 fn. 10 and 17f. The latter also emends [w]e(ṃ)t no ciṣṣe – – ñ(iś caina)nts p[o] after watäṃ, of which ciṣṣe and po seem plausible. ask(a)sk(au) is emended by 307 fn. 12 and corrected to aksaskau (see Linguistic commentary). (mā) ñ(i ci)sa emended by 307 fn. 13.
Colloquial/late ārtañye for ārttalñe; for the change lñe > ñye see 64f. Colloquial (?) kaltta(r)r for kaltär.
Colloquial/late śolämpa for śaulämpa and śol for śaul; for the change au > o see 53f.

Colloquial/late karttse(ś) for kartseśc; for the change śc > ś see 70f. Depending on the reading (see Philologically commentary) the last word of this line has been translated as German ohne Gehabe in the reading snai-tāte by 80 and as French sans tromperie in the reading snai-tā(r)śai by 24f. The reading snai-tāte (307, 78 and 18) was never explained regarding its morphological derivation, whereas the reading snai-nāne (307 fn. 21) is connected with "to appear" by 203, cf. also s.v., without any further explanation. 24f. proposes a relationship with tarśauna [TA tārśoṃ] "deception". However, tarśauna would be expected to have a singular tārśi*, cf. nom./obl. sg. , nom./obl. sg. . Obl. sg. tārśai, which seems to be attested in , could be consolidated with a nom. sg. tarśiye. In the latter case the derived adjective tārśī(cce) in b5 would be problematic since a derivative of a noun in nom. sg. -iye, obl. sg. -ai would have the oblique as its derivational basis, cf. "fear, worry, danger" : "pertaining to fear, worry, danger".

The last word in this line has been read as snai-tāte by 307, 78 and 18. 307 fn. 21 suggests snai-nāne as a possible reading as well, which is given in 72. 27 also gives snai-t/nāte. KT Schmidt apud 112 fn. 12 and 20 read this word as snai-tā(r)śai. Since there are too many possibilities and the issue cannot be settled (yet) we do not commit to a specific variant (for now).
Colloquial/late palskañe for palskalñe, for the change lñe > ñye see 64f.
Colloquial/late araś for arañc, for the change ñc > ṃś > ś see 70.
In the phrase wāya ci lauke the ci has been added by another hand according to 308 fn. 2.
lykautka-ñ misspelled for klykautka-ñ and läklentas for läklentants.
Colloquial/late kom for kauṃ, for the change au > o see 53f.

Lines Translation Pages
a1-2 No human being has [ever] before been dearer to me than you, and none will be dearer to me than you afterwards. 304

Translations from [[Schmidt KT 1974]]
Lines Translation Pages
a3-4 So dachte ich: "Mit der einen Geliebten werde ich gut [wtl. (zum) Guten] leben ein Leben lang ohne Trug [und] ohne Verstellung(?)." 182
a5-8 Gott Karman allein wusste solches mein Denken. Deshalb rief er Zwietracht hervor [oder: rief bei sich Neid hervor] [und] entriss mir das dir gehörige Herz. Er führte dich fort, trennte mich ab [und] ließ mich an allen Leiden teilhaben. Die Freude an dir nahm er mir fort. 335, 386, 469

yaltse|(ya)|ltse a1 pikwala|pikala watäṃ (·)e (–) ci(ṣṣ)e /// %5 /// ; (– –) (·)nts(·) p(o) aksaskau|ask(a)sk(au) #2b (mā) ñ(i ci)sa nauṣ|noṣ ; śaumo|śomo ñ(e)m a2 onolme|(wno)lme ; (l)āre tāka mā ra postaṃ ; cisa lāre mäsketär-ñ : #2c ciṣṣe larauñe|laraumñe ; ciṣṣe ārttalñe|ārtañye ; pelke kaltär_(käly-)|kaltta|(r)r a3 śaulämpa|śolämpa ṣe|ṣṣe ; mā t(e) stālle śaul|śol wärñai : 2 #2d taisu|taiysu pälskanoym ; sanai ṣaryompa|ṣaryo|mpa a4 ; śāyau kartseśc|karttse(ś) śaulu-wärñai ; snai tserekwa snai tā – : #3a a5 yāmor-ñäkte|yāmor-ñīkte ṣe ; cau ñi|ñī palskalñe|palskañe ; śarsa tusa ysalyai|ysaly= ersate|e|rsate a6 ; ciṣṣe|ciṣy= arañc|araś ñi sälkāte : #3b wāya ci lauke ; tsyāra ñiś a7 wetke ; «k»ly«†k»autka-ñ pāke po läklenta«nt»s ; ciṣṣe|ciṣe tsārwo sampāte-ñ|sampā|(te-ñ) a8 #3c – – – – – (–) ·e ; śaul|śol palsko|pals(k)= arañc|araś ñi|ñī ; kauṃ-kauṃ|kom-kom mī- #3d

a1 ... for a (thou)sand years ... (of) you ... a(ll) (I) announce ... Previously, there was (no) (living be)ing n(a)med human dearer to me than (you). a2 Hereafter, likewise there will be no one (d)earer to me than you. [My] affection for you, [my] love for you are together like breath a3 with life. Th(is) shall not change [all my] life long. Thus I was constantly thinking: "With the very beloved one a4 I will live (for) good lifelong, without deceit, without ..." a5 God Karma for one knew [that] this is my thought. Thus he evoked excitation. a6 He pulled out my heart which belongs to you. He led you far away and separated me [from you]. a7 He made me take part in all sufferings and depriv(ed me) of the joy provided by you. a8 ... my life, my spir(it), my heart day by day ...

a1 [lt]s[e] pi[k]ala [wa]_t_aṃ (·)e (–) c[i](··)e /// /// (·)nts(·) [p](·) ask(·) sk(· –) ñ(· – )[sa] n[o]_ṣ\ śo[m]o ñ(e)[_m\] a2 (wno)lme (l)[ā]r[e] tāka mā ra [po]staṃ cisa lāre _m_aske_t_ar-ñ\ : ciṣṣe laraumñe ciṣṣe ārtañye pelke kaltta a3 (r)_r(\) śo_l_ampa ṣṣe mā ta stālle śo_l\-wärñai : [2] taiysu _p_alskanoy_m\ sanai ṣaryo a4 mpa śāyau karttse – [ś]aulu-wärñai snai-tserekwa snai-tā – : a5 yāmo_r\-ñīkte ṣe c[au] ñī palskañe śarsa tusa ysaly e a6 rsate ciṣy ara[_śä\] ñi _s_alkāte : wāya «ci» lauke tsyāra ñi_śä\ a7 wetke lykautka-ñä\ pāke po _l_aklenta_s\ ciṣe tsārwo sampā a8 (– – – – – – ·)e [ś]o[_l\ pa]l[s](·)ara_śä\ ñī ko_m\-ko_m\ mī

a1. [[TochSprR(B) II]]: 307 fn. 9 corrects pikala to pik{w}ala, but the loss of the labial element of the labiovelar could be a feature of colloquial/late TB, see [[Fellner 2006]]. The form ask(a)sk(au) could be a colloquial/late form of aksaskau and not a spelling error, cf. colloquial Engl. aks for ask. Colloquial/late noṣ śomo for nauṣ śaumo, for the change au > o see [[Peyrot 2008]]: 53f.

a2. Colloquial/late ārtañye for ārttalñe; for the change lñe > ñye see [[Peyrot 2008]]: 64f. Colloquial (?) kaltta(r)r for kaltär.

a3. Colloquial/late śolämpa for śaulämpa and śol for śaul; for the change au > o see [[Peyrot 2008]]: 53f.

a4. Colloquial/late karttse(ś) for kartseśc; for the change śc > ś see [[Peyrot 2008]]: 70f. Depending on the reading (see Philologically commentary) the last word of this line has been translated as German ohne Gehabe in the reading snai-tāte by [[Thomas 1954a]]: 80 and as French sans tromperie in the reading snai-tā(r)śai by [[Pinault 2008]]: 24f. The reading snai-tāte ([[TochSprR(B) II]]: 307, [[Thomas 1954a]]: 78 and [[Adams 2013]]: 18) was never explained regarding its morphological derivation, whereas the reading snai-nāne ([[TochSprR(B) II]]: 307 fn. 21) is connected with [[nānā- (Gv.)]] "to appear" by [[Krause and Thomas, TEB II]]: 203, cf. also [[Adams, 2DoT]] s.v., without any further explanation. [[Pinault 2008]]: 24f. proposes a relationship with tarśauna [TA tārśoṃ] "deception". However, tarśauna would be expected to have a singular tārśi*, cf. nom./obl. sg. [[reki]], nom./obl. sg. [[rekauna]]. Obl. sg. tārśai, which seems to be attested in [[THT 213]], could be consolidated with a nom. sg. tarśiye. In the latter case the derived adjective tārśī(cce) in [[THT 133]] b5 would be problematic since a derivative of a noun in nom. sg. -iye, obl. sg. -ai would have the oblique as its derivational basis, cf. [[proskiye]] "fear, worry, danger" : [[proskaiṣṣe]] "pertaining to fear, worry, danger".

a5. Colloquial/late palskañe for palskalñe, for the change lñe > ñye see [[Peyrot 2008]]: 64f.

a6. Colloquial/late araś for arañc, for the change ñc > ṃś > ś see [[Peyrot 2008]]: 70.

a8. Colloquial/late kom for kauṃ, for the change au > o see [[Peyrot 2008]]: 53f.

a1. (ya)ltse is emended by [[TochSprR(B) II]]: 307 fn. 8. watäṃ may also be read as wat, i.e. wa_t\•, cf. [[TochSprR(B) II]]: 307 fn. 10 and [[Adams 2013]]: 17f. The latter also emends [w]e(ṃ)t no ciṣṣe – – ñ(iś caina)nts p[o] after watäṃ, of which ciṣṣe and po seem plausible. ask(a)sk(au) is emended by [[TochSprR(B) II]]: 307 fn. 12 and corrected to aksaskau (see Linguistic commentary). (mā) ñ(i ci)sa emended by [[TochSprR(B) II]]: 307 fn. 13.

a4. The last word in this line has been read as snai-tāte by [[TochSprR(B) II]]: 307, [[Thomas 1954a]]: 78 and [[Adams 2013]]: 18. [[TochSprR(B) II]]: 307 fn. 21 suggests snai-nāne as a possible reading as well, which is given in [[Krause and Thomas, TEB II]]: 72. [[Adams 2013]]: 27 also gives snai-t/nāte. KT Schmidt apud [[Otto 2007]]: 112 fn. 12 and [[Pinault 2008]]: 20 read this word as snai-tā(r)śai. Since there are too many possibilities and the issue cannot be settled (yet) we do not commit to a specific variant (for now).

a6. In the phrase wāya ci lauke the ci has been added by another hand according to [[TochSprR(B) II]]: 308 fn. 2.

a7. lykautka-ñ misspelled for klykautka-ñ and läklentas for läklentants.

Other translations

German translation after [[Thomas 1954a]]: 80:
Früher war mir (kein) Mensch genanntes Wesen lieber als du, auch später ist mir keins lieber als du. [2c] Die Liebe zu dir, das Gefallen an dir ist Atem zusammen mit dem Leben. Dieses soll sich lebenslänglich nicht ändern. [2d] So dachte ich: Mit der einen Geliebten werde ich gut leben lebenslänglich ohne Trug [und] ohne Gehabe (?). [3a] Der Gott Karman allein wußte solches mein Denken. Deshalb rief er Zwietracht hervor [und] entriß mir das dir gehörige Herz. [3b] Er führte dich fort, trennte mich ab [und] ließ mich teilhaben an allen Leiden. Die Freude an dir nahm er (mir) fort.


French translation after [[Pinault 2008]]: 32:
... mille ans ... [2c] D'être vivant portant le nom d'humain, il n'en fut pas auparavant de plus cher pour moi que toi, et il n'en sera pas non plus dans l'avenir de plus cher que toi pour moi. [2d] L'affection pour toi, l'amitié pour toi constitue le souffle associé à la vie tout ensemble. Ceci ne doit pas changer la vie durant. [3a] Ainsi je ne cessais de penser: Avec une unique amante je vivrai pour le bonheur la vie durant, sans duperie ni tromperie. [3b] Le die Acte seul a su cette pensée mienne. C'est pourquoi il a suscité la querelle, il m'a arraché le cœur tien. [3c] Il t'a emmenée au loin, il m'a entraîné á part, il m'a fait prendre part à toutes les souffrances; il m'a enlevé la consolation que tu étais. [3d] ... la vie, l'esprit, le cœur miens, jour après jour ...


English translation after [[Adams 2013]]: 26–28:
... for a thousand years however, Thou wilt tell the story (?) Thy ... I announce, [2b] Heretofore there was no human being dearer to me than thee, likewise hereafter there will be no one dearer to me than thee. [2c] Thy love! Thy affection! [My] jubilant song rises up! Along with life [itself], this should not come to an end for [my] whole life. [2d] Thus I was thinking: “I will live with one lover well [for the whole of my] life, without deceit, without ...” [3a] The Karma-god alone recognized this, my thought. Thus he provoked a quarrel; it ripped out my heart [that belonged] to thee; [3b] it led thee afar, it tore me apart, it turned me into a partaker of all sorrows; he took away the consolation [I had] in thee. [3c] ... my life, spirit, and heart day-by-day ...
